statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Penny Hardaway had 21 points, 12 rebounds and seven assists as the Phoenix Suns beat the Milwaukee Bucks 104-84 Wednesday night for coach Scott Skiles' 100th victory.
article.headline: Bucks drop second straight on road
article.linkText: Suns bury Bucks, hand Skiles 100th victory
article.story:
PHOENIX (AP) -- The Phoenix Suns' backcourt is starting to play as advertised. Penny Hardaway had 21 points, 12 rebounds and seven assists and Stephon Marbury had 24 points and eight assists as the Suns beat the Milwaukee Bucks 104-84 Wednesday night for coach Scott Skiles' 100th victory. Swingman Shawn Marion scored 17 points. "We're just starting to get into sync," Hardaway said. "Tonight was one of those games where we saw -- when all three of us are on the floor -- what we could do on offense, and as a team we played really hard defensively." The Bucks, who started 4-0 on the road, absorbed their second straight road loss. "I don't know what the cause is, but we've lost two in a row," Glenn Robinson said. "We've got to come out next game and play like it's a playoff game." Marbury had 22 points in the first half, and the Suns won for the fourth time in five games. "It was a big win for us," Marbury said. "We played really good defense tonight. We came over and made those guys take tough shots at the beginning of the game, and it carried over." Rodney Rogers had 18 points off the bench, shooting 4-for-6 on 3-pointers. Milwaukee's Glenn Robinson scored 16 points and Ray Allen had 13. Michael Redd had 11 of his 14 points in the fourth quarter -- eight during a 17-2 run when the Bucks made it respectable. "It's basketball, and this team, especially, is very much human nature," Milwaukee coach George Karl said. "They get happy, they get too cocky, sometimes they don't play the right way. They have to be slapped around and embarrassed before they wake up." The Suns had three 30-point leads in the third quarter, led 86-59 going into the fourth and went up 97-61 on Marion's follow of a 3-point miss by Rogers 3:20 into the final period. Redd hit a 19-footer and a 3-pointer to start Milwaukee's last attempt to rally and finished it with a 3-pointer that cut the deficit to 99-78 with 3:56 to go. Hardaway had seven points during an 11-0 run that earned the Suns a 13-4 lead with 6:35 left in the first quarter. The Bucks responded with an 8-0 surge, and the game was close until Rogers made a 3-pointer and two layups to help Phoenix to a 35-24 lead 3:34 into the second quarter. Late in the quarter, the Suns opened a 49-34 lead on a run that began when Anthony Mason fouled Marbury, then tried to throw him down and got a technical. Marbury made two of three free throws. Marbury scored seven points in the last 54 seconds to give Phoenix a 58-41 halftime lead. "It was a very sweet way to get there," Skiles said about the victory milestone. "The guys played great defense in the first half and still shot 46 percent. It's something we've struggled with a little bit, piecing great moments together." Game notes
In the two previous seasons the Bucks started 9-2, they won their 12th game. ... The Bucks activated forward Darvin Ham and placed center Greg Foster on the injured list. Foster, who has a bulging disc, had played in one game this season. Ham, who had knee surgery on Oct. 21, played 18 minutes. ... Suns guard Tony Delk got a right thigh bruise in the second quarter and did not return. ... Skiles (100-60) is 4-0 vs. Milwaukee since he took over on Dec. 13, 1999. The only Suns coach to get to 100 wins faster was Paul Westphal (140). ... The Suns have won 14 in a row against the Bucks in Phoenix.
